recipe.name: Eggplant Rollatini
recipe.description: Tender roasted eggplant slices rolled around a rich ricotta and pecorino filling, baked in a bubbly marinara sauce, and garnished with fresh basil and pine nuts.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Large eggplants, sliced lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick planks

steps: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C) and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
Arrange the eggplant slices on a layer of paper towels or clean kitchen towels. Sprinkle them with sea salt and set aside for 20 minutes to draw out excess moisture.

Pat the eggplant slices dry and place them on the prepared baking sheets. Drizzle generously with extra-virgin olive oil and roast for 20 to 30 minutes, flipping halfway, until tender and golden brown.

While the eggplant roasts, prepare the filling by mixing together the ricotta cheese, grated pecorino cheese, grated garlic, dried oregano, lemon zest, red pepper flakes, 1/2 teaspoon sea salt, and freshly ground black pepper in a bowl.
Once the eggplant slices are cool enough to handle, place about 2 tablespoons of the ricotta mixture at the end of each slice and roll to seal.
Spread the marinara sauce in the bottom of a large baking dish. Arrange the eggplant rolls seam side down over the sauce.
Cover the dish and bake for 20 minutes, or until the eggplant is soft and the filling is heated through.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and pine nuts before serving.
